item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Wednesday, January 29, 2025 at 5:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. DeepSeek proves the future of LLMs is open-source (268 points | 104 comments)
2. OpenAI Furious DeepSeek Might Have Stolen All the Data OpenAI Stole from Us (1031 points | 452 comments)
3. A story about restoring and upgrading a Commodore Amiga 1000 (57 points | 9 comments)
4. On DeepSeek and Export Controls (23 points | 7 comments)
5. Bacteria (and Their Metabolites) and Depression (300 points | 113 comments)
6. Frigade (YC W23) is hiring engineer #2 ( | hide)
7. I still like Sublime Text (696 points | 387 comments)
8. Seagate: 'new' hard drives used for tens of thousands of hours (180 points | 103 comments)
9. Complete hardware and software setup for running Deepseek-R1 locally. ($6000) (103 points | 54 comments)
10. Preserves: An Expressive Data Language (46 points | 20 comments)
11. New speculative attacks on Apple CPUs (990 points | 325 comments)
12. Adding concurrent read/write to DuckDB with Arrow Flight (46 points | 12 comments)
13. Cali's AG Tells AI Companies Almost Everything They're Doing Might Be Illegal (97 points | 71 comments)
14. Google Pixel 4a old firmware is gone, trapping users on the buggy battery update (72 points | 53 comments)
15. The ancient discovery that put a Silk Road city back on the map (15 points | 3 comments)
16. Boom XB-1 First Supersonic Flight [video] (656 points | 471 comments)
17. I do not want AI to "polish" me (302 points | 193 comments)
18. Proof of concept WMI virus (zero-day) (45 points | 9 comments)
19. Composable SQL (237 points | 111 comments)
20. Science YouTuber physicsgirl (Dianna Cowern) stands for the first time in 2 yrs (580 points | 211 comments)
21. IAC confirms existence of a Super-earth in the habitable zone of a Sun-like Star (398 points | 260 comments)
22. What's OAuth2, anyway? (285 points | 73 comments)
23. Jevons paradox (146 points | 114 comments)
24. We got hit by an alarmingly well-prepared phish spammer (129 points | 79 comments)
25. Maxima in the browser using Embedded Common Lisp on WASM (238 points | 49 comments)
26. Meta's Mark Zuckerberg explores purchase of Washington DC property (49 points | 34 comments)
27. Malimite – iOS and macOS Decompiler (211 points | 28 comments)
28. Cardan Grille (13 points | discuss)
29. Our phones are killing our ability to feel sexy (2024) (176 points | 156 comments)
30. Only 1 in 10 Oracle Java users want to stay with Big Red (11 points | 4 comments)
